definition[0]: not showing any feelings of sympathy, friendliness etc
example[0]: Business letters do not have to be impersonal and formal.
example[1]: Sometimes she seems a very impersonal, even unkind, mother.
definition[1]: a place or situation that is impersonal does not make people feel that they are important
example[2]: I hate staying in hotels; they’re so impersonal.
example[3]: a formal and impersonal style of management
definition[2]: in grammar, an impersonal sentence or verb is one where the subject is represented by ‘it’ or ‘there’, as in the sentence ‘It rained all day’
